A particular door never opens, blocking players way to next stage. Graphics: Average. Was not expecting more on a mobile port. Gameplay: Good. Controls are not as good as on console.

Great strategy game. It's an almost complete port of the 2013 PC game; includes all base-management and tactical-mission goodness that you could want. The three biggest issues in the game itself are: limited savegame slots (only 4? really? though not a problem if you like playing Ironman mode), semi-trivial UI issues (a few things which were easy with keyboard+mouse are not trivial with a touchscreen, like moving to a roof, and it's not hard to double-tap by mistake and cause your soldier to move) and that out of all specific missions the only one they kept was the horrible Site Recon. (Those missions are the only cut content - everything else is here, including cutscenes.) An additional problem is that the app is not updated since 2017 - either this or no-longer-present servers are probably to blame for cloud saves and multiplayer not working, and achievements/leaderboards not being viewable in the game itself (still can be viewed through Google Play Games app).
Harrowing! I can't interact with major in game items. Thus cant further the story.

Just a dude. I wanted to say XCOM is great for mature gamers who go crazy with it. However, the tutorial crashes and the campaign feels lopsided without it...Imma try again and rebuy it on PC BECAUSE...I had beat XCOM 2 with all expansions and am well aware these guys deserve honorable faith. It is NOT a cash grab or cheesy series. It's legitimate as a video game and I am picky with what I spend time on.
I've always loved xcom and the fact it's on mobile just gives me reason to play it again. No complaints as far as I'm m concerned it's flawless

A near-perfect port of the console/PC game; everything you'd expect from the higher-end releases is here in full; the combat, the base management, the many instances of KIA, it's all here! The only real compromise here is the graphics, to allow for older devices to run it. But when the gameplay is this solid, that can easily be overlooked. And since XCOM 2 will eventually come to Android, there's no excuse not to give this a go, especially at only a $5 price point.

Brilliant game, total bargain (but crashes a bit). If you don't know this game it is a port of a 2013 PC game. So for a mobile game the graphics are stunning & almost the whole game is in this version (just the odd bit of DLC and cutscene missing). Finally when you download, it warns you it might be compatible with latest version of Android. It works fine BUT it often (25% of time) crashes when you initially load. I find this less frequent if you don't use "resume last game" button to load.

Fantastic port. Turn-based games like this is perfect for mobile. Only have minor gripes. Wish there was an option to turn off double tap to move, it was never precise enough to use reliably, especially when you start using areial units. Also, an option for scroll speed would have been amazing, rather than having to swipe a whole bunch of times to look around the larger levels. Some minor graphical glitches too. Overall, this is the best PC port I've ever played. Definite buy.

Overall just as good as the original, a great strategy game. Multiplayer won't work for me, kills battery fast (one mission can take over 15% easy), hots up your phone and is missing some content like cosmetics and cuteness but is still outstandingly fun, one of the best mobile games I own.

The list of accolades goes on as does my gratitude. Thanks dev team for delivering the goods again.

A great port of the peerless XCOM: Enemy Unknown/Within that was released for consoles in 2012-2013. It does have some graphical issues and a couple of minor issues/bugs but nothing game breaking. Well worth the price and great value for what you pay.

Worth the money, they fixed most of the problems. I just wish it was a bit easier to rotate the camera. There's a bug with the carapace or skeleton armor where you select decor 2, there is an arm brace floating in the air and stretches your characters arms when moving. Other than that if you want an xcom game on the go then I recommend buying this. You can play it on the plane as an "offline" game, so it's a great time killer without a real repetativeness to it like other mobile offline games.

Far from another idle clicking, ad infested, p2w rubbish... this is a fully loaded port of one of the all time greats. Its a banger.

Amazing Game, but cloud-saves and multiplayer are broken. It looks like the game's Google Play Games integration is broken due to back-end updates and 2K has no plans to restore functionality. Otherwise it is a fantastic game, with everything the desktop version has (except a couple of DLC that another reviewer mentioned)

The biggest thing you need to know is that the mobile port is missing a large chunk of customization options. The console versions came with the Elite Soldier and Slingshot DLC. Those two added a significant amount of customization options to the soldiers. So if you're buying the mobile port because you think you will have access to them, you wont. Customization options feel limited without those in the DLC. Less maps and no voiceover in different languages as well. Other than that, it's XCOM.

PSA: For everyone complaining about the controls and such... look people the game is massive for a mobile game so its gonna heat up your phone which can make the touch screen malfunction. If the controls are starting to act up, your phone is probably too hot.. turn it off or put an ice pack on that bad boy for a few and you should be good and keep your screens clean. That's all.

Likely the best mobile port ever. Some customisation options have been lost, there's a drop in graphic quality (duh), a couple of mission types are excluded, and the camera has a bit of a do on some levels. And... that's it. The only qualification is that you need to be happy sitting down and plugged in - this ain't for your commute. I really hope Xcom 2 will follow.

It runs well and is a lot of fun, but bear in mind this port hasn't been updated in basically three years. Samsung S8 here and it runs perfectly, so I'd suggest that some of the negative reviews below are issues on the user side. Simply a fantastic game that, if it is your cup of tea, will last you dozens of hours. Bit dangerous on your phone though, as there is nothing to stop you playing in bed instead of sleeping!

Go for it! A really admirable port of a great PC/Console game. If you've played XCOM, and you like it, then this is just a port. The controls on this felt more fluid than the PS3 version. If you've never played XCOM, then here's the highlights: A (great) turn based, aliens vs humans strategy game. Multiple classes for your soldiers, progressive unlocking of gear and abilities, and a game with consequences. So much so that I've actually ruined campaigns. Arguably the best strategy game you can get on your phone. It eats up 3 Gigs, though, so be mindful.

I love the PC versions of this, however, I got a new Lenovo P10 Tablet and bought this specifically as my first game to play on it. It loads, it looks great and then you start to play. Once you get past the first scene and you hear the base command center talk once to give instructions on your first movement, that is where it goes to hell. After that there is only music.  There is no voices from command or from your squad, nothing from enemies and sound from walking, gunfire explosions nothing. When contacting support through the support page, they told me to do all the things on the website and then told me to contact support for the app from the game, which isn't even an option. Then they told me to disconnect my wi-fi and bluetooth and when none of this worked, they told me tough luck, they can't help me. While I can technically play the game, without sound it isn't the same and the fun is lackluster at best. If you have a newer tablet, I do not recommend getting this.

near perfect emulation of one of the best turn based strategy games out there. a few niggles: sound randomly comes on for certain events - i have all volume settings set to 0. and the sound is always on during the intro videos. i want silence... camera controls to switch between levels is clunky. lots of cut scenes that would be nice to avoid completely. the animation of the drop ship leaving/ returning seems pointless as you can skip them instantly, if you remember...

It's xcom. Graphics downgrade is severe compared to pc, but that's expected for a mobile platform with a variety of devices. The graphics are good enough that you can get all the visual info you need. The camera and controls can be a bit wonky, but the vertical level arrows are much appreciated. You can get done what you need done. Load times were short and not a problem for me. The game itself is outstanding as usual from xcom. Always more interesting to do. Great to pass a lot of time.
Straight up Awesome! Almost exactly like the PC game, one of the best ports on Android. A must have and must play. well worth the money!

Brilliant android port

The standard-setting definition of what a turn-based tactical RPG with procedurally-generated & roguelike elements should be like. Any other developer that ever considers to venture into this genre and attempt to make a tactical turn-based RPG that would have similar randomized level layouts, permadeath for squad members, and major base building elements and squad member skill trees should seriously look to this game for what they should be striving to accomplish within such a similar vein. XCOM: EW, simply put, is the epitome of tactical RPGs, and perfectly executed with no negative drawbacks or glitches of any kind that I can think of. For those serious gamers who welcome a challenging game, and that enjoy a game more the harder it becomes, this is one of those rare must-owns on the level of Dark Souls for turn-based games. An exceedingly great game that is extremely unforgiving. Make sure to make lavish use of the manual save system!

Overall though, this game is amazing, I haven't encountered any crashes on my Samsung S8, though I did sometimes on my Samsung Note 3. None the less, greatest PC port to mobile around. Had to change my rating due to not be able to select any tile on any roof. 
It caused me to get stuck in a mission for over a half hour because one 
alien wouldn't get off the roof and I couldn't get an angle and couldn't 
throw any grenades. The game itself is true to the original, but man are 
the camera angles frustrating if you're trying to do anything inside or on 
top of a building that has more than one floor. It also auto-sets the 
camera to the max zoom setting, forcing me to zoom out for every action I 
want to do, it would be nice if they could enable you to set a preferred 
height for the camera. Another thing maybe worth mentioning is this game 
causes my phone to get very hot very quick. While this isnt anything new it 
does feel like it happens quicker than with other games. Filled with so 
many little bugs makes gameplay super frustrating at times, not worth 10 
bucks imo.

To start with, it's a very good port all things being equal. The controls are a little tricky compared to a mouse & keyboard but that is to be expected. The gameplay mechanics are as good as ever but for me are starting to date a little. I am running the game on a Galaxy S8 and I can tell you that glitch wise, this is the worst thing I've run on my phone. It's damn near unplayable to the end, and I have a crash rate of approximately five times per mission. Hopefully this will get patched up but I'm not confident. I've seen a lot of reviews glowing about the graphics etc but really, we should be expecting this kind of quality by now, especially for this price. If the glitches and crashes are resolved this will be a good game, a bit better than average and well suited to mobile devices due its turn based strategy. If it remains this buggy I'd say it's the biggest rip off on Google Play and the Shadow Run remake represents far better value.

I am playing this on my Galaxy S5, version 1.2.0 as of May 2016  People are saying they are experiencing crashes and graphical glitches. I am not experiencing these. People are saying it's a battery-drainer. Duh, it's a PC/console port.  XCOM: Enemy Within is a spectacularly well-made game for PC and console. The mobile port, however, doesn't quite live up to the original.  For starters, there's the framerate. I get about 20fps on my S5 with nothing else running. It's playable, but it's not optimal.  There's also the user interface. Everything on the management side is as well laid-out as it could be, with a few exceptions: one, it takes forever to load out your characters, as jumping into their inventories has a load time; two, camera and movement controls are sometimes hard to work with; and three, some crucial bits of information (like what exactly the continent bonuses do) are omitted.  That's about it, though. Nothing in this game has been omitted from the original, which is wonderful. The only problems are just part of having a mobile port of a console game.  4/5, I would recommend this to XCOM veterans, but I recommend first-timers play it on PC/console.

This is one of the greatest RTS games of all time, if you haven't played this on PC it's a must have game! The game is getting a little long in the tooth but that said it still looks great. These isometric top-down style games were in my opinion made to be played on a touch screen device. Story is great, visuals are top notch, and the most important thing, core game-play mechanics are once again superb. Even though I played this game years ago on my desktop PC, I am loving it all over again! In a world filled with mobile games that try to rob you for every dime you have with in-app purchases and pay to win this is one of the few that charge you an honest price and give you a complete game and experience. Support these guys let the industry know that this is the type of games and more importantly the type of pricing that we The Gamers deserve and yes it is possible to be profitable without in-app purchases and pay to win crap.

This is what led me to buying it on the PC. I honestly didn't think I'd see it here on the Google Play Store.  It's a game, through and through. There's no micro-transactions, it's a huge file (for mobile games) it's turn based, perfectly suited for mobile.  It's a port though, so it has a lot of things removed, like certain cosmetics, maps, entire spoken languages for soldiers, severely reduced graphics, missing cut-scenes (from what I can see, the removed ones involve autopsy and interrogation) but I think it's pretty damn good for what it is. It even retains multiplayer, which is something I didn't expect. (Nobody seems to play it though, never did once find anyone else playing)  It pales in comparison to the PC version, but it's worth it's salt if you really need it on the go. It can be pretty cheap, I got it for three bucks, and it's normal price is 15. A bit steep for a mobile game, but it isn't a mobile game. It's a port from PC.  This ran really well (though with some slowdown) on my Galaxy S7 edge.  If you try this game, and REALLY like it, go get the superior version on PC, which is on Steam. The price can be a little demanding, but it has far more content, and mods.

This upgrade pales in comparison to the original release, it feels like a rushed out patch leaving the game crashing constantly and with many visual glitches. My main issue with this game however is the terribly coded enemies. When playing on "Original" difficulty, the enemies are clearly playing with a different set of rules to the player. Yeah, I've run this game pretty much flawlessly on my LG G5 but I loaded it onto the newest LG V20 and I immediately saw Fog of War issues and invisible soldiers, aliens, and Meld containers. Same Qualcomm 820 chipset, same RAM, but these new phones run the Vulkan version of OpenGL, and I truly think THAT'S the issue. Galaxy S7 phones run Vulkan too, and they have the same issues, I tried. 2K needs to redo the game to run under Vulkan. Thing is, XCOM was ported by 2K China, and they shut down last year...

I'm a huge fan of this game and it's sequel on PC, but regret spending money on this Android port. I love the game on the PC and got it for my Samsung S5.  The lack of a zoom feature makes it difficult to play on a phone, but would have been better on a tablet, except that this game is incompatible with many popular tablets. It's surprising that it won't work with  my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 and Asus Transformer.    Although I do love the game in general, its very disappointing that the bugs and the minor irritants in the PC version made it through the Android version. It seems like 2K did a direct port and completely ignored all the feedbacks from gamers.   App stability is also very poor and It often crashes on my S5. It even fails to load at times, often requiring several attempts. In some severe cases, a restart of the phone is necessary.   Overall, its a nice effort by 2K but they really dropped the ball on this one.  Even with its low price, it still feels like I overpaid considering the things I have to put up with.

A nearly comprehensive port of the PC game to mobile. I've rarely experienced crashes, and none of the display bugs others report (running on a Samsung Galaxy Tab A 9.7"). There are some playability issues, like not being able to select who to use medikits on and the difficulty with changing height levels. One warning for experienced PC players: at any given difficulty level, the Android version is unpredictably harder than the PC version, handing you more and harder opponents earlier  (on Normal difficulty, three Sectopods on a single large UFO crash clearance, an Ethereal on the base defense mission).

This game has a vast array of paths to victory. It starts out chaotic and the paths you choose lead to various advantages and hinderances.  Turn based strategy is a niche sector, but they did it really well. Movement controls can be frustrating at first but are quickly offset by the depth and intensity of the action.

This is simply the best turn based strategy game out there! I will continue to search for another to live up but xcom reigns supreme. Just buy it, you won't be disappointed and there's no in app purchases to get ahead. Faithful updating of the classic console platform now on your mobile.

Best $10 I have spent thus far on an app!!!  Vs all other reviews, the only new thing to add is this game WORKS almost flawlessly on my Nexus 10 tablet, which is NOT on the compatible devices list (only crashes occasionally when connecting to google, never crashes when I'm off-line).  So of course this is totally strange that many reviews talk about crashing on approved devices where I have a case where it runs great on a non-approved device.  I don't get it, but just glad I found a workaround.  The game is seriously amazing and unparralled for squad-turn-based strategy action!!  Frozen synapsis has the added challenge of simultaneous turns, but in EVERY other department, I have found no parallel to XCOM.  I know I'm late to the game (no pun intended), but better late than never.  Kudos 2K!!!  Bring out more titles ASAP and in future please address the weird compatibility issues, this game was made to live on big screens!

I've been playing this on my 2013 Nexus 7 the last few days, and it's amazing how well it replicates the experience of the desktop version of the game on an Android tablet. It may be the best desktop-to-Android adaptation I've ever played. There are just three major problems with it that made me knock stars off.  From least to most serious, they are:  1) The auto-save function only makes one save at a time. This is annoying to someone who habitually takes advantage of the desktop version's three-savefile function to rewind past a disastrous mistake and replay differently.   2) The movement system can be problematic. It can be tricky to figure out how to tell the thing you want to move up a level, because frequently the higher levels disappear. More than once I've ended up moving a character right out into the open on a lower level when I meant to move him into cover on a higher level!  3) The game is prone to corrupting itself to the point where it won't start. It throws a "resources not found" error, and per 2K support, the only way to fix it is to remove and reinstall‚Äîto the tune of an hour-long, several gigabyte download! It's happened to me twice so far in as many days.

Xcom is a fantastic game. This is a competent port of that game. All the major features are here so you're in for a tense and rewarding multi-layered strategy game. However, there are some graphical artifacts and the game normally crashes the first time I try to load a save (Nexus 5x). The controls are a bit fiddly, particularly when dealing with multiple floors in a level and this can get frustrating. All these niggles are relatively minor however and the greatness of the original shines through.

Superb Game! Been playing it for nearly 3months now. A perfect mix of strategy and action. The storyline is very engaging, and just when you think you're nearing the end, something else creeps up.   It has a slightly steep learning curve. I'd never played any XCOM game before this one so it took me about 3hrs to get the hang of it but since then it has been a very entertaining experience.   No distractions of ads, in-app purchases etc.   I have to add that it's a battery drainer, but with all the detail they've put into it, it's absolutely expected.  If you like strategy games, you'll LOVE this one.

This version is OK. It's devoid of the autopsy cut scenes from what I've noticed so far. I bought this version and the PS3 version on the same day and am paying very close attention to the upcoming PS Vita release XCOM: Enemy Unknown Plus and I just wanna say this... PLEASE 2K, DO NOT SIMPLY PORT THIS HALF-ASSED VERSION OVER TO THE PLAYSTATION VITA. The graphics, while ok, are downgraded a tad bit and it'd be a shame to have this game lazily ported over to a more powerful console like the PS Vita. I want all of the cut scenes in there and improved upon graphics for XCOM: Enemy Unknown Plus. Oh? And whatever you do, please do not include touch screen controls in the Vita version. I think I speak for every Vita owner out there when I say "touch screen controls on the PS Vita suck and are highly unnecessary. Your game doesn't have that many intricate controls to warrant touch screen. I mean, we can all play this with the d-pad and the X button alone. So please.. NO TOUCH SCREEN CONTROLS! But overall? I'm rather impressed. I play this version more than my PS 3 version. It feels more natural on a handheld device rather than that of a couch console so I hope you do XCOM: EU+ justice.

I have played XCOM/UFO since the early 90's & find this edition worthy of the original 20 years earlier, as it has kepted true to the original. This game is the full PS3 game, with a massive file size of almost 3GB. The other games like this, such as arma tactics & breach & clear are also very good. This game however is the original turn based shooter with more character development, resource management, research development & Base management than the rest put together. The number 1 tactical shooter on Android, but please remember this game is for tablets only & will not work on phones very well unless your screen is around the same size as a tablets.

No annoying freemium content, no ads, just a good game. The game play is top- notch and allows for many hours of non-repetitive action that always keeps you on your toes. There are aspects of strategy, luck, terror, and frustration all wrapped up in an engrossing and evolving storyline. This game was worth every penny. The user interactions are great, though the biggest complaint I have is that some of the touch navigation is a little difficult. Seriously, just a fun game.
Got this on pc and ps3. They've done a great job of getting this running on android. Works well with the touch interface and looks great on my lg g3. It does run the battery down quick though.

Deep and involving turn based tactical game. Mission lengths are perfect for short mobile gaming sessions, while the overall campaign can last for weeks. However, touch controls can be annoying, especially for multiple elevations and grenade free aiming. The UI text is also too small for the smaller phones.

I've been playing this exclusively for a while now and just finished it on normal on my nexus 7 2013.  I've not played xcom before. This is one of the best games I've played. Just got to psych myself up to replay it on a harder setting...

A lot of people are complaining about the battery drain. Well no kidding. It's a very resource intensive game. A lot of calculations on the CPU side, and a lot of detailed environments and sfx on the GPU side. Takes a bit to get used to the control scheme, but it works well for the most part. Wish it had the DLC, or at least the customization pack for soldiers. Even without those, it's still an incredible game, and easily one of my favorites
The only time I wish there was MORE to buy, I'd love to have the elite soldier pack purchasable  for even more customizable  fun! Works great on the 5active!

This port is, for lack of a better way yo put it, good enough. The downgraded graphics and missing maps don't bother me. But there are some issues with the sound, and the controls, that I wish were handled better. However, the control issues can be dealt with, because this is a turn based game.

Playing on a Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition and all was going well until recently. Now it constantly crashing without any error message or information of any kind. I've tried restarting, updating, closing background apps, you name it I've tried it. It seems to have started occurring once the DLC kicked in and the EXALT started wreaking havoc..... Other than the random crashes it's an amazing game. The graphics are crisp, the audio sounds amazing, the point and click interface works flawlessly, and the story is extremely compelling. I always find myself doing "just one more" mission. A this being said I initially rated the game 5/5 but with the recent set backs my opinion has changed. For the reviews that complain about it draining their battery....  What do they expect? When you see the in game and cut scene graphics it will become obvious what's draining your battery. You can turn the settings down which will increase your battery life, but why do that when you can marvel at the beautiful sights and sounds the XCOM:EW has to offer. Even with its short comings if I could go back I'd buy it again everytime.
Doesn't work on the nexus 9 but enemy unknown does.Hopefully they add support soon otherwise you're stuck playing EU and you cannot buy that anymore :/

I would loke to start by saying that I LOVE XCOM! You will not be short of challenge and fun in this well crafted masterpiece of a game. PC version that is. I feel that this mobile port, though admirable, is currently unplayable on my S4 due to the sheer processing power required. Because of this I'm surprised there isn't an option to lower the graphics settings in the menu.... This could help potentially. Would love to pick this up again when either I get an upgrade or the coding for mobile is optimised.

So after already having shelled out for the original XCOM I decided to buy this glorified expansion pack - at full price. Sure, people who bought the first game are getting shafted, but I can put up with that if it means we get more excellent full ports.  So I buy this, and after it spends hours downloading and my refund window expires, I find it won't run on my Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5, despite the fact the original was compatible! So I'm stuck playing it on my tiny little Nexus 4. Why are phones from two years ago compatible but cutting edge tablets - with the kind of screen that this game deserves - are left gathering dust. Awful.  At the very least we deserve a compatibility list so we know what to buy. I hear this isn't even compatible with the Nexus 9!

When the guy that gets carried over from Mission 1 is selected, and he selects the cannon, the game breaks, can't cancel out, nothing.  I think it's the Tutorial about 'aiming' that comes up at this time (when cannon is selected) that breaks the game.  Buggy.   I've read some reviews and it seems this is happening to a few people already and there has not been a patch.  I'm going to replay, restart without the Tutorial.  I hope this works.  I still haven't seen how you can gracefully exit from the game.  (Edit:  You have scroll down from Pause Menu) I also sent an email to 2K about 3 weeks ago and have not heard a thing.    I'm lowering this port of a great game to 3 stars given these issues.  Edit:  Play without Tutorial, fixed the issue in Mission 2.  Back to 4.

XCOM was one of my favorite games to play on PC when I was younger. I loved playing Enemy Unknown on the PS3. I am still amazed that this is a PS3 game on my Xperia Z3. The game pays great on the phone, just make sure you have a charger since it drains the battery fast. $12.99 may seem like a lot for a phone game, but this is the same game the Playstation Store will charge you $39.99 for on PS3. I much prefer paying for a quality game than being nickel and dimed with IAPs.

Heats up a lot and kills the battery in a hurry on my HTC One M8...any improvement to that would be appreciated...also I'd prefer the option to play offline so I don't get achievement emails while I play (also to save battery) That said, they game plays perfectly, a few hangs, but seems to put me right back where I was on relaunch.  Offline single player mode would help run a lighter app load while gaming, so that's my biggest wish.  Great job keeping true to the Xcom of old - very challenging.

5 star game!  1 star at the moment is because it allows my Samsung Tab S 8.4 and Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 12.2 to download the game, but it is unplayable on both the Samsung tablets. Both tablet runs the game, but crashes as it loads the mission. So in a way, the game doesn't work!  Tested device: (Working) HTC One M7, (Crashes on loading first mission: Samsung Tab S 8.4 & Samsung Tab Pro 12.2) I have both XCOM Enemy Unknown and Enemy Within on PC and I loved it. Although the game is a bit laggy at times on my HTC One M7, the gameplay aspects of XCOM on the PC is still the same. It is fun and very challenging! The game itself, when working is a 5 star game, and that is what I'm going to give it when it is playable on both my tablets. Until then, I will leave it at 1 stars so the developers will know that there is some issues with the game that needs to be fixed!  Edit: They no longer allow my tablets to play the game. Just my HTC One M7. I can only assume they have take that ability down so they can fix up the app before the release it to my tablets. So for now, since my HTC One M7 runs the game decently well and fun to play, I will leave 5 stars.

Had a lot of fun with xcom on my PS3 but it'd be nice for it to be optimized a little better on my Nexus 5 and have full immersion mode so the buttons will hide and I don't accidentally press them. Overall its cool as hell to play this on mobile.

Thankfully I'm keeping my Note 3 as this game runs ok on Note 3 fhd resolution. Update: the game is still not stable crashes and can't progress because can't load saved game :(

Only gripes are that you better have a great charger to keep up with this game (1 amp will still result in a drain on my 2013 N7) and there is still no way to change uniform color (helps me identify unit class at a glance).
